page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The local guide to Historic Houses in Somerset lists the following entry {"POUNDISFORD PARK},near Taunton, now owned by Mr.and Mrs Ralph Vivian-Neal, is a charming example of Tudor country architecture started in 1546 and perfectly preserved with little later alteration.It is set in the former {deer park}of Taunton Castle.Several fine plaster ceilings of the period are complemented by furniture, portraits and interesting small collections of porcelain and of costumes.It has always been very much a family home,but among the many visitors who stayed over the years was Queen Anne,wife of James 1. The simple garden is typical of the Tudor style and has views over the towards the Quantock and Blackdown Hills." A VERY DETAILED{LOCAL HISTORY of Trull was compiled in 1953 by the Womens
